runs.comm: good length ball on off stump, carefully defended
bowls short, angles it a bit too far down leg with short fine leg up in the circle. A perfect example of not bowling to your field and the sweep shot races away

short fine leg is well in play this time! Rahane tucks it around the corner and sets off. But behind the wicket is the non-strikers call and Vijay does take a few steps down. But suddenly he decides there arent any runs here and sells his captain a dummy
good length ball angled in on middle and leg, nudged towards short midwicket
goes for a reverse sweep to a fuller ball sliding down leg. Does well to connect and find a single to short third man
shortish length ball skidding in on middle and off, defended

starts wide of the crease and bowls a back of a length and outside off. Uthappa gets an inside edge onto pad. The ball wanders into the covers and he was looking to [pinch a single. Vijay this time yells no very very early
length ball sliding down leg, Uthappa works it away to midwicket
plants that front leg down in front of the stumps and is flicking around it. Very inviting signs for an lbw call. This ball beats him and hits him a bit too high though
fuller and wider outside off so his front foot lunging across works to his favour. Drives to cover
sweetly driven over mid-off. Overpitched from the medium-pacer and Uthappa is a top-class driver of the ball. Strong man, and this being the new ball, comes onto the bat better
oh, thats crisp. Picks it off a length and whips it away from middle stump to deep midwicket
clipped away past short fine legs left. Just waited long enough to use Utseyas angle into the pads to his advantage
good length ball outside off, tapped to long-on
full on middle, driven down to long-on
gorgeous timing. Too acute an angle into the batsman, and all Uthappa had to do was use his wrists. Does so quite well
No, yells Vijay again with his arms aloft. Uthappa dabs it to square leg, straight to the man too, and then looks for a run
good length and outside off, pushed to long-on
stays low! Hits a good length and gets the ball to cut back in at Uthappa. So he had to block, but finds the ball skirting below his bat. Luckily it doesnt move enough to threaten the stumps
poor ball, short ball, pulled away through midwicket. Indication of how easy it is to hit that length is that Uthappa pulled off the front foot
good length ball just outside off, defended
neatly done. Waits for the shortish offcutter to reach him and then nudges it well to the left of short fine leg. Beautiful shot
another short ball, another belt through the leg side. Cant keep bowling short. Even if it is the slower ball. Uthappa is on the front foot and heaves it away
fullish on off stump, much better length and the result is a dot ball. Fielded at mid-on
immediately gets in the act.Its very full and cuts in late to strike his front pad. Vijay was looking for the flick and is beaten on the inside edge. Would have slid down leg
shortish and outside off, chopped into the covers
fuller delivery, slower as well, defended to cover. Vijay picked the legroller
good length, off pace delivery on middle. Worked away to deep square leg
too short, but Uthappa doesnt have to move off his front foot. The bowling is slow enough, the pitch isnt fast enough. Pulled away to the backward square leg boundary
short fine leg is inside the circle. So why is he bowling down leg? Picked away off his hips to the long leg boundary
flighted on leg stump, driven to long-on
length ball, launched over midwicket. Slog sweep from Vijay gets good results
tossed up just outside off, Vijay looks to smear it through the covers and gets an inside edge to long-on
gets some rip off the pitch. And its quick turn because hes bowling quite. Uthappa was looking to flick against the turn and is squared up

thats well played. Nails a reverse sweep, and does so against a pretty full delivery. The secret to his connection though was that he didnt get down too low on that. Needed the higher vantage to power the ball though by his own pace rather than when batsmen get low and derive their pace from the bowler

now thats what I call an intro. Simple, flat legspinner on off stump zips under Vijays bat and topples the off stump. Went for the ball seeing the flatter trajectory, which helps beat him for pace. Really not short enough for that shot
jumps back outside off and cuts a shortish delivery on the stumps to point
tossed up just outside off, driven into the off side

does him in with the googly! Cremer as it pitches on middle and leg and skids on to beat Pandeys harried flick and strike him low enough on the pads. But the problem was this ball would be heading down leg. Impact itself was very marginal. Umpire Tiffin pulls he trigger a bit too early
slower through the air, tossed up outside off, Jadhav respects it with a drive into the covers
just a shade short, and Jadhav is on the pull. Seems a risky shot though with Cremer getting some skid off the deck
good length ball outside off, dropped in front of point for a quick single
flighted on middle and leg, turned away through midwicket

thats a third wicket in two overs! Uthappa gives it away much like Williams himself had done with the bat. Pops a return catch, a slightly tougher one because this was quite well timed and Williams had to stretch his hands over his head and take it almost as it passed him on his right. Uthappas very good on the drive, but this time he forgets that doing that in the air straight at the bowler might become problematic
bowls full, and it appears to be the arm ball too. Gets an inside edge as he tries to defend into the off side. Single through midwicket
good length ball just outside off, defended
shortish and outside off, defended
pulls, and mistimes it to long-on. Short enough for the shot, but again it comes on quicker. Thats off because this is a pretty dry, slow pitch
flighted on middle and off, defended
looped up just outside off, driven sweetly to deep cover
tossed up on off stump, worked away to deep midwicket
pushed through on middle, whipped away to wide long-on. Cremer himself sets off after it. Good committment, but  the batsman get the the two they wanted

down the track, but Cremer doesnt flight the ball this time. Nudged into the midwicket region and has hit is soft enough to entertain thoughts of a couple, Muzarabani is the fielder running in from the deep and hits a direct hit. An off balanced direct hit, purely on instinct. Jadav is a little lax, doesnt think he was in any trouble. But this is some spectacular work from Zimbabwe
good length ball on off stump, defended. Thats you big guy, says the keeper
pushed through on middle and leg, clipped behind square leg
flighted in on off stump, defended
gets down the track and works it wide of long-on. No thoughts of a second run this time, Binny immediately says no once he reaches the non-strikers end
pushes off the back foot, but Raza at cover is sharp. Pressure being built quite nicely
beaten outside off as Samson defends inside the line. Plays the angle of the ball, but it grips the pitch and turns sharply enough
down the track and slashes a length ball outside off to deep point
flighted outside off, Samson leans into a pretty drive through the covers for a couple to get off the mark
flighted on off stump, driven calmly to long-off
down the track, but this seems like the googly? Binny was looking to lift it over cover and instead the ball skews away to to long-on
goes back and flicks through midwicket
nudges to long-on, looking for a second but it isnt there. Binnys quite keep to play Cremer halfway down the pitch
guess thats why he likes using his feet. Charges at a flat delivery on middle stump and smokes it over extra cover
top class footwork again. We have seen this tons of times. Once the spinners charged, he goes short. Binny is waiting on the back foot and cuts so late that the sweeper has no chance
goes back and dabs through the covers
full toss on off stump, Samson guides it through the covers for a single
pushed through quicker on middle and off, because Binnys been keen to jump down the track. Easy single to long-on
fuller delivery on middle, Samson keeps it out capably
good length ball on middle and leg, nudged but not too far off the crease
pushed through down leg, Binny goes for a sweep but cant connect
full and on the pads, clipped to square leg
picked away through midwicket for a single. Strong bottom-handed push
fuller delivery on off stump, driven through to mid-off
opens the face and drives the fuller ball on off stump to cover
leans forward and drives through to the sweeper to pick up a single. Good batting so far. They know the target is only 54 runs away, and they have 42 balls in hand

outside edge, and it is thick enough to lob short third man too! That must be some bat he has. Moves forward to try and flick a good length ball through midwicket. Closes the bat face too early, but the punch had enough on it that the resulting nick lobbed the fielder
back of a length and outside off, slid down to third man in the deep
seems to change his action, goes all slingy and delivers a fuller ball on middle. Nudged through midwicket
slower ball outside off, Samson looks to slice the ball behind point. He thinks theres a simple single, but Binny wasnt interested. helpfully Utseya misfields
shortish and outside off, cut behind point
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed to long-on
flighted outside off, turned to short midwicket
goes for a reverse sweep, but this one is a little quicker. Raza spotted the batsmans movement and keeps him quiet
runs it behind point and picks up the single on offer
gets down the track and drives to long-off. Raza bowls it flat and short.
flighted outside off, swept away strongly to deep square leg
fuller and outside off, sliced to short third man

what a catch! Runs in from the long-off boundary, dives forward after the ball, gets his hands low enough and then claims a great, low catch. Binny had charges at the leggie, but gets too close to the pitch and has to shovel it up in the air. That means he doesnt time it as well. Harare is abuzz. They sense something special here and fittingly Cremer, having taken two wickets in an over before, and Chibhabha, who hit a fifty, combine for this key wicket
short and way wide outside off, Samson dabs it to short third man and sets off for a quick single
flighted just outside off, defended
good length on off stump, swept away to deep square leg
low full toss on off stump, swung away to deep midwicket
good length ball on off stump, pushed down to long-on. Thats the end of Cremers spell. Top effort from the leggie, 3 for 18
pushed through on off stump at a good length. Axar was coming forward with a push, gets an inside edge onto pad which saves him from the lbw
slices the good length ball behind point as the Harare crowd clap the dot ball
and the clap the single as well. Axar gets forward and drives to long-on. Buzzing crowd, always fun
flat and short on middle, whip-pulled to deep square leg
down the track and slashed over the covers. Misfield from Muzarabani this time. Took his eyes off the ball at the last minute, thinking about the throw

dropped by Cremer at extra cover! Axar is itching for the big hit. Sees the width outside off and throws his bat at it. Connects really well, the fielder has to dive full length to his right. Just evades him
back of a length and outside off, nudged through midwicket and the fielder on the boundary takes ages to get in. Axar pinches a good two
leaps down the track, but Mpofu bowls the offcutter short and way wide of off stump. Axar who was also making room barely connects with the bottom of the bat
slower short ball, this time Axar stands still and pulls to wide long-on
picks out long-on! Harare roars. They are on the cusp here. Mpofu looks skyward and pumps his fists. Bowls length, sees Samson go for the big hit but he hasnt timed it well enough to beat the fielder

good ball, nice and full just outside off, but Axar has done really well to get a boundary through third man. Waits nicely, plants an open face down on it and picks the gap between short third and point
fuller ball quite wide outside off, Axar goes for a slash and misses. Rather the keeper misses, and Mpofu has his hands on his head. Was there actually an edge there?
lands the yorker on middle, Bhuvi works it through midwicket and shows good desperation for the second run
sees a fuller ball way outside off, plants that front leg across and scoops it over square leg
beautiful yorker. Axar was looking to smash it over the leg side, but then realises that there is no way he could do that and nearly falls over himself while trying to protect his stumps

full toss caught at deep midwicket! Great work by Williams running to his left and catching it over his head. The force is with them. This Harare crowd has taken care of that. The players are piling on top of each other in the huddle. Straight forward change to clear the boundary, but Axar doesnt make the requisite connection
outside edge skewed through extra cover for a couple of runs.
another low full toss, which is slugged away along the ground to deep midwicket

finds the yorker on middle, Bhuvi gets an inside edge which wanders away to the fine leg boundary. The fielders - Chakabva and Utseya - end up nearly making a mess of it, and India gamble on that to pick up three. Keeper cant collect the sub Chakabvas throw
take a bye after Mohit swings and misses at a good length ball outside off. Coventry again couldnt take the ball cleanly.
nine down! It was a low full toss, curling in late. Bhuvi is unable to make connection as he tries a slog. Coventry takes the ball, throws it to the bowler, who in turn underams a direct hit
Raza moves to his left, throws himself high into the air, hes horizontal with the ground. He looks spectacular, except he cant pull off the catch. Fuller ball ends up being a couple of runs
lands the yorker on off stump, bunted down the ground
low full toss on off stump, clipped away through midwicket. There it is! Zimbabwe share the T20 series 1-1
